column4: What runlevel do I have to set so that Ubuntu will boot into command-line rather than GNOME?
You won't be dissappointed, {Fah-Q}
Can you just uninstall gdm?
I don't want to uninstall GDM, I just want to boot straight into command line once or twice
there are different ways, but you could just uninstall, then re-install when yer done
or, I'm not sure if just temporarily doing cd /etc/init.d ; mv gdm gdm.OFF    would work or not ?
what {Fah-Q} said, and there's a little tool I think you can apt-get called 'rcconf' that will help with managing services.
whatcha waiting for?
CDs...
ordered them just before the Nov 11 deadline
me too
command line interface
re: FTPD's: the big 3 (not counting wu, which regularly shows security holes like a mac truck) appear to be proftpd, vsftpd, and pure-ftpd -- FWIW
permission to scan your IP?
OK I won't scan your IP
